reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So much organized shoe space!!!!
reviews.reviewText: This was a great buy for our family. Well, my wife and daughters anyway. We easily filled this thing with boots and shoes and flipflops and crocs and omg why do we have so many dang shoes in my house. It's very sturdy. The wheels make it great to move if we drop something behind it. The shelf size of each row is prefect for little kid or size 13 boots. Read the instructions on putting it together. It's very simple but you need to do it in order. I highly recommend this shoe self.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality design, puts your shoes at your fingertips.
reviews.reviewText: I live in a very old house, with almost unusable, tiny dark closets. Did women not have clothes in the early 40s? Sharing with my husband means I can put about four pair of shoes there-on the floor.When my son moved out, I decided to turn his room into a closet. I also want him to come home now and then, so I keep it organized and attractive. The first thing I bought was this shoe rack, and it does that, and pretty well, I think. Of course, I love shoes so I never mind seeing them.I’m old enough to have grown kids, and I put it together myself. Not a hard job at all. It rolled easily to where I wanted it, and then I locked the wheels and it hasn’t budged.My shoe size is 6.5 and the shoes fit. One or two of my super high heels are a bit small for the rack, but with the heel over the bar they stay on. A piece of cardboard would fix it if they didn’t balance properly, although I wouldn’t use that fix for more than a couple shoes. Fortunately, I rarely wear 5 inch heels any longer so there is only one pair with that issue left.I love having them all organized and in place, and we have a lot fewer shoes lying around the house. Those over the door racks and circular revolving racks never worked for me, not to mention the hanging one shows the bottoms of the shoes so it’s not attractive. This will also keep me from buying too many shoes, as I plan to limit myself to what can fit. (In the interests of honesty, I have two ikea pull down shoe cabinets but I keep slippers and flip flops in them.)My rack currently has 45 pairs of shoes and I can easily fit 50. In the old days I’d have needed two, but now that I’m not working I can get by. Count your shoes before you buy. I don’t think you can double up easily and certainly not with heels. The spaces between racks are small so you’d need very flat shoes to double.Heels, pretty as they are, just aren’t a part of my lifestyle any more. Ease and comfort are, and walking into a room, seeing what I have, and grabbing a pair for the day is worth it. I’d been rummaging through various places I kept them, and trying to remember if I had them and where they’d be.., and this is so much easier. I’ve had it since December, and I count this as one of my most useful purchases. You may too.So tell me, were 50 pairs of shoes really not something women had in the early 1940s? How primitive!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Needs two people to build
reviews.reviewText: With two people it’s simple to build goes together in about 20 minutes. It holds 4 pair of my size 10 ladies shows per shelf. It’s sturdy. I did not use the rolling castors that came with it but they are good quality so I saved them. This rack is quality compared to others I viewed, I’m very pleased with my selection. My closet is 8’x10’ and it’s like shopping in a boutique with the shoe rack. I have room for a second and I will want it so I will purchase while it’s available. It’s one of those things if you know you’re going to want another one, you wait, and while you snooze you loose, out of stock or not available anymore. Live and learn. I’m buying another. A fantastic value, solid, looks attractive for a shoe rack in a home closet. I say it’s 5 STARS for me. (I have big feet)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I originally purchased the under the bed shoe storage system, only to realize my bed did not have the clearance. This is perfect. For shoes that are out of season, I load this up and move them to another room. Easy to put together. Very strudy. I would purchase again as a gift for others. If I ever have a shoe sale, this would be perfect to display all the shoes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Shoe Rack
reviews.reviewText: It is surprisingly difficult to find a non-plastic shoe rack. This one is lightweight metal, sturdy, easy to assemble, perfect size, and works great. My order didn't come with screws for the back brace, but that is a minor setback and an easy fix for an otherwise great purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holds lotta shoes
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Built quickly, holds a lotta weight and have it holding 11 rows of shoes 5 across now. More shoes than I can imagine. Need one more!

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice shoe rack
reviews.reviewText: A bit shaky but good for the price. We used it since we had so many visitor and can’t put the shoes outside.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectly functional shoe rack that really hold 50 pairs of shoes
reviews.reviewText: I really truly love this shoe rack. First, the price is incredible for the quality of the shoe rack. Second, it actually does hold 50 pairs of shoes (Women's shoes). Third, it is mobile. And lastly, it's pretty sturdy.Details: Shipped quickly via Amazon Prime. Box was undamaged upon arrival and packaging was adequate. Assembly was not too difficult, only took about 30 minutes. Some pieces required a little elbow grease to slide together. Fully assembled product is sturdy and mobile. This is key since I needed storage space for my shoes but the only open space in my room was in front of a seldom used exit door. Loading my shoes onto this rack, I realized that it is like any other rack of this style-- if you have high heels, the heel will encroach the space for the shoe on the rack below it. No big deal for me. Also, if you have anything higher than an ankle boot, you will need to put them on the top rack or on the floor below the bottom rack. Each rack has a coating that helps to prevent shoes from slipping off the rack. Each rack actually does hold 5 pairs of women's shoes. Even fully loaded with shoes, it is still easy to roll from one location to another. The wheels also have little locks on them to keep them in a stationary position. It is worth mentioning, if you have small children, there would certainly be a tipping hazard with this rack. Overall, this is a great value for shoe storage.

This shoe rack is perfect! Easy to assemble. Sturdy construction. Fits lots of shoes. You can easily remove some of the bars to fit in taller boots if needed. Best part is that the rods the shoes sit on are metal and covered with a texture so the shoes won't slip off. I read reviews on shoe racks with plastic shelves that were dust magnets and fabric shelves that would sag over time and you can't easily clean them. I also like that it has castor wheels for easy moving. If you have bigger feet, I wouldnt say this will hold 50 pairs, but 40 for sure. This rack is perfect and at a fair price!
Veloce arrivata, facile da montare (da sola), robusta e stabile, tanti scarpe. Però bottiglioni ho messo sopra, perché non c'è spazio abbastanza in altri livelli.

This shoe rack is easy to install and you get instruction manual along with it. It's very sturdy and light weight, easily movable. It's a must buy if you are looking for large storage with good organisation of space. The delivery was on time and item was well packed.
J'ai enfin trouvé un meuble à chaussure résistant. Avec plus de 50 paires et encore de la place

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The rack is self-assembly, the only tool needed is a Phillips screwdriver, although an electric screwdriver is a big help. Construction is straightforward - I found it easiest to lay out the 2 sides flat on a double bed, then pick each one up and attach the first rail. After that, adding the rest of the rails is easy, with the rack becoming more rigid as each rail is fitted into place with the final rigidity being achieved with the addition of the 2 rear cross braces.The 4 castors screw into place witb the aid of the supplied thin spanner, note that the 2 with the brake mechanism should go at the front.I won't, however, be using this as a shoe rack - I intend to fit shelves, and use it for an instrument rack.Overall, you get a lot of well engineered metal for your money and the rack is sturdy and versatile.
